title: [debug assertion] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Using a `rustc` built from commit 853c4774 with debug assertions enabled (`debug=true` in config.toml), I'm seeing an internal compiler error on the following input (found by [fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/dwrensha/fuzz-rustc)):

```rust
pub trait Foo {}
pub trait FooExt where for<'b> &'b &mut Self: Foo {}
impl<T> FooExt for T where for<'a> &'a mut T: Foo {}

fn main() {}
```

```
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/bin/rustc main.rs
error[E0637]: `&` without an explicit lifetime name cannot be used here
 --> main.rs:2:36
  |
2 | pub trait FooExt where for<'b> &'b &mut Self: Foo {}
  |                                    ^ explicit lifetime name needed here

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: !value.has_escaping_bound_vars()', src/librustc_middle/ty/sty.rs:877:9
```
